intro: Borrichia arborescens var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth tree hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It is characterized by its woody stem and showy, large, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, distinguishing it from other varieties of Borrichia. This plant thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dune environments. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
